unit.comment: /* * In most scenarios, we always call MarkBufferDirty first, then call XLogInsert * to generate WAL and real lsn, so the buffer's oldest lsn will be set by * MarkBufferDirty. But there are always exceptions that call XLogInsert first * to generate WAL, then call MarkBufferDirty. The later MarkBufferDirty will * set a oldest lsn that greater than the real lsn, that will cause a wrong * consistent lsn, it is not as expected. * * So if we call XLogInsert first, we will call this function to set a fake oldest * lsn like MarkBufferDirty. */

function.name: polar_set_reg_buffer_oldest_lsn
